name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings & all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to pre commencment inspections
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Clearing extents to be marked out as per drawings and ATC's/ RFI's.
○ Southern Outlet Highway is Road A0171, Link 5, CH 0.33 to CH 0.00.
○ Davey Macquarie Couplet Main Road A1010, Link 5, CH 0.00 to CH 0.09.
○ Davey Macquarie Couplet Main Road A1010, Link 10, CH 0.00 to CH 0.1 (approx.)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
RESPONSIBILITY: Surveyor / Site Engineer / Foreman / Clearing Contractor
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, including: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PMP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, Work Pack
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.3 - Implementation of environmental measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
○ EMP meets the requirements of the specification and all controls have been implemented as per approved EMP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Spec Cl160.24 EMP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
○ Vegetation to be removed clearly marked and agreed. All removal consistent with contract drawings and permits.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Vegetation Removal and Clearing Permit
FREQUENCY: Prior to comencement of any work
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to the commencement of any work, the Contractor and the QAV shall conduct a joint inspection of the site to identify vegetation to be retained and protected.

○ If directed by the QAV, existing trees, shrubs, native grasses and groundcovers and other areas of existing vegetation shall be protected by temporary fencing and incorporated into the works by the Contractor.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Vegetation Removal and Clearing Permit, Tree Protection Plan
FREQUENCY: Prior to removal of vegetation
○ Nominated sites of archaelogical and / or heritage significance inspected on-site and clearly identified and protected as No-Go zones
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Vegetation Removal and Clearing Permit, Tree Protection Plan
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check that all relevant approvals (Access to 241 Davey, 326 Macquarie) have been granted including verification of the works area.
○ Ensure work pack is reviewed & signed
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Property Access Approval
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: DBYD - locate and mark all existing services and confirm clearance from proposed work
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: DBYD Records, Plan Mark-Ups, Excavation Permit
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Consider the requirements for traffic management, ensuring all works comply with required TMS, TMP and TGS. Where localised speed reductions are required they shall be at the discretion of the QAV. TGS shall be submitted and approved by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.1 - Clear and grub trees and vegetation

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Area within specified limits cleared of all vegetation, refuse and obstructions down to natural surface. Trees brought down in a manner so as to avoid danger to personnel and traffic as well as damage to other trees, structures and property.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.3 - Clear and grub trees and vegetation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In areas where excavation is to occur: all vegetation, refuse and obstructions totally grubbed or grubbed > 0.3m below subgrade and batters (whichever is the lesser treatment)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.4 - Clear and grub trees and vegetation (embankment areas)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In areas to be covered by embankments < 1.0m in height: all vegetation, refuse and obstructions grubbed > 0.3m below stripped surface OR > 0.6m below subgrade level (whichever is the lesser treatment)
○ In areas to be covered by embankments > 1.0m in height: foundations may remian if located or cut off not more than 0.4m above natural surface but not less than 1.0m below subgrade
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.5 - Clear and grub trees and vegetation at culvert sites
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Clear and grub trees and stumps within 10m of any proposed bridge or culvert having a waterway area > 6m2 (unless otherwise shown on drawings)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Any remnants of pits shall be backfilled with similar material and compacted to a density ratio of not less than 95%. The calculation of density ratio shall be based on Standard compactive effort.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All vegetation within clearing limits shall be removed from site. Weeds not to be mulched and disposed of appropriately.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Immediately repair any damage to fences to a condition at least equal to that before damage
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Co-ordinating works with activities involving the salvage of plants and the collection of cuttings and available seed from areas of native vegetation on the site.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
